subject: CBS NEWS SUNDAY MORNING: America's story
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






June 29, 2007
 


It’s 
      America’s birthday, and this Sunday Morning, 
      we’re having a party. All through the program, we’ll be telling you 
      stories about America and Americans.
Among other destinations, 
      we’ll look in on a gathering of brand new American citizens, we’ll visit a camp for children of 
      military personnel in Iraq, and 
      catch up with a group of workers who take pride in every "Made in USA" label they place on the guitars they 
      manufacture. 
We 
      cannot tell a lie: Correspondent Joie Chen takes a look at the REAL George 
      Washington.  No, he didn’t have wooden teeth.

It 
      was ten years ago this coming week, that Sunday 
      Morning’s original anchor, Charles Kuralt, passed 
      away. We’ll mark the occasion by remembering Kuralt’s love of the American 
      spirit.

From 
      Martha Teichner, we have a close-up look at the remarkable photographic 
      record of Ellis Island’s hospital 
      ward.

And 
      then, it’s on to Bob Schieffer -- 
      wearing a very different hat.  Bill Geist talks 
      with Bob about his new career 
      as a country music performer.

Those 
      stories – plus an homage to corn on the cob – this Sunday 
      Morning.
Listen for our trumpet!
